questions.question: What is a narrative nonfiction story?

choices.answer: It is like a newspaper article.
It is based on true events, but told like a story
It is written by a scientist.
It is not true.

questions.question: What does commander in chief mean?  George Washington was Commander in Chief.

choices.answer: a doctor
in charge of weapons
leader of the military
recruits soldiers

questions.question: Draw a conclusion from the quote in the image...

choices.answer: The author likes winter better than summer.
The author doesn't make any sense.
The author skips many months, moving from winter to summer.
The author skips several years in this sentence.

questions.question: What generalization/conclusion can you draw about Molly Pitcher?

choices.answer: She was courageous (brave) and cared about the soldiers.
She was mean and didn't care about the soldiers.
She was strong and took over the battle.
She was scared and didn't know what to do.

questions.question: What is a ramrod ? Look at the sentence in the image.

choices.answer: a cannon
a bullet for a rifle
a container of gunpowder
a stick for pushing

questions.question: Draw Conclusions: Why was General Washington surprised when he saw Molly firing the cannon?

choices.answer: He thought Molly was a coward.
He though Molly should have stayed home.
He was angry because she broke the rules by firing a cannon.
It was very strange for women to fire cannons.

questions.question: How do the rising and falling actions make the ending even better?

choices.answer: The show how Molly lived when at home.
The events show why Molly was honored for her bravery.
They compare Molly to other women.
It shows how Washington became a general.

questions.question: What was a theme of the story?

choices.answer: Women are cool.
It is important to be brave, even though you may be afraid.
Don't fight, it isn't worth it.
Stop bringing people water, it isn't nice.
